title: Premier League App
desc: My first React app. It shows the current English Premier League table, which updates after every game. It also shows information about clubs, such as rosters, previous fixtures, upcoming fixtures, etc. I used the combination of class-based and functional components, as well as react-router. App is hosted on Netlify, and it uses football-data.org API.

title: Mini NBA App
desc: Second React app from the category of sport. This time I used only functional components with React hooks. Of course, there is also the react-router. The emphasis of this app is on the player's stats, but there is also basic info about teams and the upcoming games. It's also hosted on Netlify, and it uses balldontlie.io API.

title: Two Dice Pig Game
desc: This is my first app from the category of browser games. The game has two dice and two players, playing in rounds. The player can roll any dice except 1 (then all his round score gets lost), or two 6 (then all his global score gets lost). The first player who reach 100 points on the GLOBAL score wins the game. This app is hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: Typing speed test
desc: A test that measures how fast you can type. The program shows random sentences, and it is up to you to type them identically in the text field on the page. When you finish, you have an insight into the WPM parameter (words per minute). This app is also hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: Weather App
desc: Simple weather app which uses external API to get information about current temperature and other stuff. It also uses HTML Geolocation API to get the geographical position of a user. Hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: Tasklist app
desc: One of the rare cases where I have used a CSS framework, which in this case was Materialize.css. This app uses browser's local storage. Like previous apps, this app is also hosted on GitHub Pages.

title: Restaurant Cache
desc: I made this website for a restaurant located in Belgrade. It's designed and developed completely from zero, and it uses a custom made WordPress theme. There are no WordPress plugins included, except one for site migration.

title: Lilo - The Center for Healthy Eating
desc: This website is also designed and developed completely from zero, and it also uses a custom made WordPress theme. Again, no other WordPress plugins. For this project, I have used custom post types.
